list.name: React
list.description: I learned React when I was doing coding bootcamp training at Hacktiv8. Since then, I have used React throughout my projects with other modules such as React Router and Redux to create my personal projects.

list.name: Redux
list.description: When I learned React, I also learned state management with Redux. My experience with it is that I have understood how state management flows throughout different components from the store, to calling dispatches.

list.name: Vue
list.description: Vue was another front-end framework I picked up really fast after React to help one my local church (Acts Church) to create a database interface for their newcomers into the church. I love developing applications with it, since it is simpler to understand.

list.name: CSS
list.description: CSS has always been like my go-to personal customization language whenever I don't prefer a style on a UI library like Material UI. I am comfortable with it since I am very used to concepts such as flexbox. I also used it to create simple animations such as transitions.

list.name: HTML
list.description: I learned HTML from an online course at Coursera teaching Bootstrap. I am confident with my HTML knowledge and used it almost every time I develop a new project.

list.name: Bootstrap
list.description: I learned Boostrap from Coursera, and it was my introduction to the world of front-end web development. With Bootstrap knowledge I was able to also migrate to other UI libraries such as Material UI easily with its similar concepts. Now I mostly use Material UI.

list.name: React Native
list.description: I have experienced in developing Android apps with React Native, and it was a really easy experience instead of using Android Studio. I am still at an introductory level at best, but I am able to piece together front-end components and understand its layout.

list.name: MySQL
list.description: I learned and practiced a lot of SQL when I was doing Databases unit at my university, using Oracle SQL. I went from using Oracle SQL to MySQL, and I was able to catch up really quickly with the basic concepts since they were really similar to each other.

list.name: NodeJS
list.description: I was introduced to the back-end world through NodeJS, since it was the first thing I learned. Currently I have a basic understanding of NodeJS with concepts such as asynchronous calls to making APIs with Express.

list.name: Git
list.description: I use Git almost every time when I'm developing a project, and I have used it with teams to manage different versions of my project.

list.name: Python
list.description: I learned and practiced a lot of SQL when I was doing Databases unit at my university, using Oracle SQL. I went from using Oracle SQL to MySQL, and I was able to catch up really quickly with the basic concepts since they were really similar to each other.

list.name: Javascript
list.description: I was introduced to the back-end world through NodeJS, since it was the first thing I learned. Currently I have a basic understanding of NodeJS with concepts such as asynchronous calls to making APIs with Express.

list.name: Golang
list.description: I started learning Golang after developing an interest

list.name: Java
list.description: I use Git almost every time when I'm developing a project, and I have used it with teams to manage different versions of my project.

list.name: C
list.description: Most of my skills I developed with using C were around maintaining and developing HPC applications such as OpenMPI and simulating scheduling algorithms for various processes.

list.name: Typescript
list.description: I learned Typescript during my Programming Paradigms unit in my university as part of the functional programming course. I was able to pick up the language relatively fast and create applications with it using Observables such as the Asteroids game I made.

list.name: Algorithms/Data Structures
list.description: My understanding of algorithms and data structures is relatively strong, since my units has enforced this knowledge, I have learned to develop an algorithmic thinking and approach when facing a problem, especially after many practices and training solving algorithmic-related problems in university and spare time.

list.name: Object Oriented Programming
list.description: I learned OOP at my university unit, and have understood the concepts of SOLID and DRY principles, the benefits of encapsulation and polymorphism, and many other coding practices that I learned and lived by.

list.name: UX Design
list.description: UX design was one of the most appreciated topics that I have recently learned and undertaken in my university, and it had brought me a different perspective on how I view the front-end system and how it should be organized and practiced to provide the best user experience for the users.

list.name: Black and white box testing
list.description: My Software Quality and Testing unit has taught me the theories of black/white box testing such as branch coverage, MC/DC, data flow testing, and many more methods, and also ways to design test cases that have a high coverage. I learned concepts such as mocking using Python to test various test cases that calls a mock API.

list.name: Functional Programming
list.description: I have a general understanding of functional programming from theory to implementation with Typescript and Haskell.
